website_summaries.verdict: A basic, stable weight tree that will hold 2" weight plates.
cons: Some brands of plates overlap due to size and layout of pegs

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: love it, it's a lot less expensive than others, so I thought I would try it, works great for me, easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Da Momster

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget friendly rack that works for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Rack arrived quickly and in good condition. Assembly was just four bolts to attach the feet, pretty painless. I have four 45lb plates on the lower left, four 25lb plates on the lower right, four 10lb plates on the middle right, and two 5lb plates on the upper right side. All are Golds Gym (see photo) Rack seems sturdy enough, and so far it also seems pretty stable. Time will tell if it holds up, but for now I just wanted to provide a pic to show how it works with my Golds Gym plates since there seems to be a pretty sizable difference in dimensions from one brand to the next.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely poor
customer_reviews.text: This rack lasted less than a month. It broke right at the weld where the corner of the triangle meets near the feet. I'm not abusive with my weights at all. But for this thing to break right at the weld means the weld was crap. WILL NOT BUY AGAIN OR RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Graves

customer_reviews.title: The Rack Came with No Bolts and No Nuts!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good rack but it came with no bolts or nuts. There are several other Amazon customers, who have written reviews, who had the same experience — so be aware when ordering that you may have to take one of the legs to your local hardware store and buy nuts and bolts. Budget the possibility for an extra $10 in cost plus your time when ordering this product. If mine had come with the nuts and bolts, I would've given it five stars but the inconvenience and added cost plus the fact that it appears not to be an isolated event, leads me to clip three stars from its rating.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Suarez

customer_reviews.title: plate rack is quite stable
customer_reviews.text: I bought and assembled this for my husband as a gift. The CAP plate rack is holding up extremely well for costing less than $50. My husband is able to utilize all bar posts and although some plates (the 5s and 10s on the side with the 3 posts) do overlap, this has not been an issue for him. This plate rack is quite stable - there is currently close to 500 lbs loaded on it and it has not wobble. Overall, I'm please with this product since it is keeping plates off the ground and making the garage gym more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh

customer_reviews.title: Arrived bent and bowed.
customer_reviews.text: The main A frame section of the weight tree was bent and bowed. This defect was not due to shipping. The box was undamaged. Sent CAP and email and waiting to hear back. Very nice and sturdy if not for the defect/damage. Ordered 2 and love the undamaged one. Much sturdier than other weight trees I've had over the years and priced very reasonably. Fingers crossed that CAP will resolve the issue ASAP. I will update this review when I hear back from them. 6/30 - No word from CAP yet.
customer_reviews.author: Casey E McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Good product, minor design issue
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit that is easy to assemble and very sturdy. I took off a star because there was not enough room to fit both 10s and 5s on the first and second bar on the 3-piece side. The spacing is just too short. I assume the issue is because i have older plates and my 5s are 8 inches in diameter as opposed to 7.5 which seems to be the new standard, but I think thisnproduct could have been designed with at least a little flexibility in mind. It's not a major issue, just an annoyance. It's still a good buy and a solid weight stand.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Doesn't work well with CAP plates.
customer_reviews.text: Eh. It's strange that the CAP weight set doesn't fit properly on the CAP weight tree. As others have mentioned, when you put the 25, 10, and 5 lb weights on one side, the 5's and 10's overlap. So I have to keep the 10's on the bottom center bar, since they won't even fit on the top one. Im practically picking them up off the floor at that point. It's just such an obvious mistake in the design, and it's incredibly annoying. Maybe if you use another brand of plates, they'll fit better. I wouldn't have bought this if I had read the other reviews first. Oh well. At least it's cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser

customer_reviews.title: Junk welds on rusty metal!
customer_reviews.text: This plate tree came with a broken weld, you can tell they just tried to weld two pieces of rusty metal together and panted it black. Do not order this junk. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J. Parent

customer_reviews.title: Bad stability, defective base stand and not Sturdiness at all.
customer_reviews.text: This product is selling in a decent price, but once I installed everything and found out the stand uneven, bad stability. Not sturdiness at all. I am afraid not to out any bumper weight on this junk. Update: Really disappointed with their service, sending me a replacement for the wait of 2 months. This is unbelievable. I don’t think 4.5/5 rating is coming as true review these days. Aweful:(
customer_reviews.author: Ling T.

customer_reviews.title: Only one spot to put 45# weights, and it's not the bottom middle.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and is pretty sturdy. You do get some wiggle when moving 45# weights around, but that's expected. My biggest disappointment was in peg placement. You cannot put 45# weights on the bottom center peg, or on the side with 3 pegs. I was going to put 2 45s on the bottom center peg and 2 on the right peg, but the weights are too large for the bottom. So I tried to put them on the left side, but then the middle peg is unusable. So now I have 2 45# plates leaning against the wall and 2 on the storage rack.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He loves it. I would have given it 5 stars if Amazon had'nt sent it USPS. The post office said it was to big & heavy and refused to deliver it. I had to go quite a distance to pick it up & it was heavy. I would have gone to a sports store & purchased one if i knew i would still have to pick it up. However, I was refunded since this was purchased with prime. After all that, it is a good, Saturdy, product & works & looks as described.
customer_reviews.author: Danie

customer_reviews.title: Good value, sturdy, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the smaller, lower prices CAP olympic plate tree, which is tiny, tippy and requires more assembly. This tree is sufficient for my needs and the upper section is welded, so the only assembly is to bolt on the cross brace legs. Seems sturdy enough, and we don't have a huge number of plates but these easily fit at the same time: 4-45, 2-25, 4-10, 4-5, 2-2.5. My only caveat is the stand is not quite flat on the floor when unloaded. 40# takes care of that.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel942

customer_reviews.title: Solid, budget-friendly Olympic plate rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice Olympic plate rack for my 300 lb. Olympic weight set. It assembled quickly by tightening four nuts with a ratchet wrench. The plate rack could definitely hold more weight and it is sturdier than I thought it would be. In order to get the weights to all fit, I put the 25 lb and 45 lb plates on one side, the 2.5 lb, 5 lb, and 35 lb plates on the other side, and the 10 lb plates on the bottom. I would purchase this item again!
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled it today, it was super easy. It holds all my plates. I have a 300lb Olympic set. It got scratched a bit when I was putting the 45 plates on it. That’s honestly not a big deal it holds the plates and does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda

customer_reviews.title: It's working....FOR NOW. How long it will hold up is up for debate...
customer_reviews.text: While this weight rack does what I need it to do, I'm really not sure it's going to last very long. The metal triangle portion is extremely flexible when racking and unracking weights which leads me to believe it's not going to last very long. It wobbles considerably when racking weights and flexes inward on the right side where you rack your 35's and 45's. I would honestly not recommend buying this rack and spend a little more for something with thicker posts.
customer_reviews.author: krS

customer_reviews.title: Will work but ......
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will get job done, but welds look pretty rough not really excited about the big hole in the weld on top ..... but for price I guess you get what you pay for , but it does look to clean up my gym and get my weights off floor . Do your self a favor and get a 17mm socket and drill to speed up installation process. It will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in home gym, best value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value for home use. It holds all my plates easily. I have 6x45lbs, 2x35lbs, 2x25lbs, 2x10lbs, 4x5lbs, and 2x2.5lbs quantity plates. Don't let some bad reviews fool you, some people aren't that bright and complain about everything.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Rogue Echo Bumper Plates
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheaper alternative to buying plate storage from Rogue hoping it would accommodate the Rogue Echo plates but the plates overlap so I was unable to completely utilize the weight tree. I'm sure it'd be perfect for regular sized olympic plates. The stand itself feels strong although there is a slight wobble to it as the base doesn't sit completely flush with the ground at least on my unit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sturdy, stable. I have more weight on mine than I should, and have had no problems. Like other people have said you might not be able to fit your plates on the exact way you want to so you might have to get creative. I have 2 of these and they work great. Like to hang belts , wraps, straps, and clamps off of them also.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s meant for
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy, easy to assemble, and can handle the heavy weight it’s built for. My only complaint is the paint. It’s starting to chip already. I expected this, since I’m sliding metal weights on and off this thing but I didn’t think it’s happen so quickly. I plan on using plastidip on this to keep that from happening in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and it holds the weights well, but the feet are only attached at the base through the middle. That means if you get any amount of weight on the thing and you twist it, the feet will turn as well and it becomes unstable. Then you have to take all the weight off and straighten the feet out correctly. Wouldn't buy again, get something more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Simple to assemble. Nice looking rack. The assembly is simply to screw in 4 bolts. To do this you will need a 17 mm wrench (not included) or some universal wrench. If anything negative, it is not too big, so there is limited space for large plates. Other than that, very satisfied with this purchase, I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Average but works for the price
customer_reviews.text: Holds the plates decently but isn't the most sturdy. The bases are hollow so make sure you don't put the bolts too tightly or you'll start collapsing the metal. Works fine in my garage and decent price but I'd be weary of adding a full stack of weights on here as I only have about $200 pounds all together on there (only 2-45s, 2-35s, rest are smaller weight plates)
customer_reviews.author: jasnyds123

customer_reviews.title: Not that bad
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read some reviews stating that the welding on it is not the greatest. Maybe I was lucky, I received a good one. I didn’t expect to be super heavy duty but it is good enough for my need. I will give it a 5 stars if only the unit is completely stable, because mine has a bit wobbly on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months before it bent
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 4 months before it bent from putting two 25 pound plates on one of the arms, customers service said "we just offer a 90 day warranty, therefore we can't help you'. I'm an almost 70 year old Powerlifter with 2 other brand racks that I've had over 20 years that are a little rusted but with zero bending, Sad, but I wont buy CAP equipment again.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: All you need is a wrench!
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased a weight rack and I’m pleased I did. This is perfect for anyone looking to store their unused plates. Shipping was quick, assembly was very easy also. Incase you’re worried about fastening the nuts don’t be. All you need is a wrench and it righty tighty for those not mechanically inclined. As you can see in my photo it holds my 2 45lb and 2 35lb plates on one side. The only thing that was “off” was when I unpacked the parts they gave me a Allen wrench, except there’s no need for that particular tool. All you need is a wrench, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Weak Welds
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a completely destroyed box and one of the two most critical welds holding the metal to the base was broken off. Now I'm stuck with a broken plate rack or I have to figure out how to ship this monstrosity back, which is likely to cost way more than I paid for this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a breeze. Threw about 250 pounds of plates on it. There was some wobble in the uprights but after the initial weight was in place it was pretty solid. Curious how its going to hold up over time with continual taking on and off plates, but seems sturdy enough, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Fart Williams

customer_reviews.title: Rock-Solid and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took five minutes with a single socket wrench, and this thing is heavy, stable, and solid. Pairs of 44lb, 33lb, 22lb, and 11lb Olympic plates, and 4 5.5lb plates fit perfectly, with room to spare. I could have doubled the number of plates and it would still be sturdy and stable. Great product, especially at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, easy to assemble and holds weight well. Use this in our home gym setting. I did add a 2x4 under the middle support leg to avoid having the leg bend down when weight is placed on the tree. I noticed sagging there and proactively added the support board. That is the only weak point of the design and that bottom support bracket could be a thicker gauge.
customer_reviews.author: DIYDADDY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy plate rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is very sturdy and holds all of my 2" Olympic Grip Plates ranging from 2.5 lbs to 45 lbs. The rubber base is a nice feature as it isolates the rack from clanging around when loading and unloading plates. Unfortunately, 45 lbs plates overlap when attempting to store them on both the top and bottom pegs of the two peg side.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: broken weld on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: just got around to opening this up today to put it together. upon opening the packaging which had a little rip on it, nothing to major, i discovered that the point of the item was separated at the weld. i still put it together and added all my weights to it and it still holds but is a bit wobbly when adding/removing weights. doesn't seem like it would cause much of a problem, but the fact that a weld was broken upon arrival doesn't speak well for the item and its build quality. its an easy fix that I will do on my own, but i will be hesitant to purchase other items from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: 4 useful pegs
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 5 because you can only use 4 out of the 5 plate holders. No matter how I shuffle the deck of 2.5s, 5s, 10s, 25s, 35s, & 45s.... You will only ever really get to use 4 pegs. No one buys a weight tree to hold ALL the light weight plates.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive all the parts
customer_reviews.text: This rack was shipped to me without one of the legs and it came without bolts (as so many of the reviews have mentioned). It is unusable as is. I've tried to contact CAP but have only gotten a standard answering machine that does not announce the company so I can be sure I'm calling the correct place. I would suggest ordering another rack to ensure you get what you want. (I'll update this as needed.)
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Good home gym gym plate rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is fairly big. Holds my plate set with no problem. Easy and fast assembly and doesn’t wobble. Great buy for a home or garage gym. The paint on the pins that hold the plates scratches easy, but that doesn’t affect the stability of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Shore

customer_reviews.title: Decent Plate Holder For the Price
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect superior quality for the price. It was really easy to assemble. Just grab some pliers and carefully tighten each bolt or you'll scratch the paint. It comes in a glossy finish and the pegs are welded so keep this in mind. Otherwise, this is a great stand for holding olympic plates that you would use for basic exercises. I would look for a better option to store bumper plates though like a rack add on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap paint but works
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese paint scratches off almost immediately. The metal is very thin and the bottom plate post is not suitable for anything bigger than change plates as it will bend. It will do the job though. I use this rack to hold my older cast iron set of around 300 pounds. Would recommend if you need a cheap way to get your plates off the floor. Just don't expect it to look pretty for long.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good, however it has a weak horizontal lower bar.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice plate tree. The only issue is that, once loaded with a modest (not crazy) amount of plates, the bottom horizontal bar on the rack sags downward. A lot. I placed some steel shims under the bottom bar, and this resolved the issue. Just a little bit under-engineered in this area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Works for the small gym set up I have at home for days I don't have time for a full lift. Seems sturdy. Depending on your weights, they may run into each other when on the rack but if you proportion them out properly this issue would be nominal. Be sure not to over tighten the leg bolts, as they are hollow and will begin to collapse in on themselves by force of the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: asmz_me

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.text: Finally able to get our plates off the floor! This was easy to put together, and the wide base with rubberized feet makes it very stable and stays in place. Even using the center rods for holding our smaller plates keeps them all accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Price
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to organize my 8 45 pound plates and a few pairs of 25 and 35 and 10 pound plates. This tree can hold them all. I use 45s on both bottom sides, but it's probably not meant for those plates on the one side where three arms are stacked, so I often skip the middle rung on that side. Still, great alternative over laying them all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Crucifix Gym

customer_reviews.title: Came without hardware
customer_reviews.text: The box this thing came in was completely mangled, but the product looked overall like it was in good shape. There weren't any scratches in the metal or anything. The only real problem was it came without any hardware. The instructions/parts list definitely mentioned the 4x nuts/bolts/washers and none of that was included. The only items in there were the actual rack and the two support legs. Now I have to work through CAP directly to get the hardware. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fits most 5s and 10s
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this weight rack. It is sturdy and easy to put together. With regards to the 5/10 lbs weight not fitting, it is a certain type of weights (silver Standard brand) that don't fit but you can just put the 10s below and the rest will fit. I have attached a photo to better illustrate which brand doesn't fit and also an easy solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sandbek

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy, but it’s definitley intended for metal plates
customer_reviews.text: Our bumper plates do not fit. Every single plate has to be on the same peg. So we still have to take plates off to get to the plate we need. They might as well be back on the floor. Also, it doesn’t hold all of the plates on those two pegs that work either. It is sturdy, but it’s definitley intended for metal plates. We will probably return it because it doesn’t function like we need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for our basement gym. Holds a lot of weight and is very sturdy - I'm not concerned with it tipping over. There is enough room for all of our plates (ranging from 2.5-45 lbs). From top to bottom we have 10 lb, 5 lb, and 35 lb down one side, 25 lb and 45 lb on the other, and 2.5 lb on the inside. No issues with plates fitting or removing/replacing each plate.
customer_reviews.author: sfink22

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment For Anyone With Plates
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I didn't invest in this product due to a lack of room in my apartment. I regret not purchasing this product earlier because it is a MUST-HAVE for anyone with plates. Prior to my purchase, my plates were stacked on top of each other under my bed and it was always annoying to utilize them with my EZ-Curl Bar or Hex Bar. The Plate Rack is a great product that I wish I purchased years ago. It has made my workout area more organized and saves me time during workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Munir

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This weight rack is a good value for the price. It holds al the weights I have (including bar collars). The weight are easy to access and there is sufficient space to accommodate large plates. The footprint of the rack is compact enough to fit into smaller spaces and allow access to the weights.
customer_reviews.author: GAM

customer_reviews.title: Weight tree could have been spaced a bit better. Some of the weights overlap near the top of the tree.
customer_reviews.text: It’s been over a year now since I ordered this product. It’s still standing tall. My setup has just under 400 lbs stacked and I’m confident when I load or unload the weight tree. The top seems to be spot welded but the distribution of weight makes it balanced and true. It’s not commercial grade but at this price point, I didn’t expect golds gym. It’s a personal weight set.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed and constructed
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to assemble and has just the right number of places to rack weights. They are also distributed appropriately so I don’t have weights overlapping each other or bumping each other. It’s a solid design!
customer_reviews.author: B. Kohl

customer_reviews.title: It holds all my weight just fine
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical since this weight rack significantly cheaper than some of the others, but it works fine. I have a 255lb olympic weight set and they all fit on there and it's sturdy and holds them perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 🌟 purchase: great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great value, very stable, high quality, good price. Minus 1/2star because the post angle is slightly too steep. This means that 45lbs weights with steel hubs bang together and might pinch fingers when loading them. At the gyms, I think the posts are level and they work well. Perhaps if the weights had lower quality hubs be with more friction it wouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sr

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other cap products I've bought, the box was torn with screws all over the place. It's already starting to scratch and wear from placing and removing weights from it, but it's sturdy enough and does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rodo

customer_reviews.title: Weight Tree
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Spacing is a little off on the tree. Three arm side of tree should stack 5-10-35 on the plates, but instead it stacks 10-5-35. Not a big deal. Little wobbly but not bad. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Geyer

customer_reviews.title: Great olympic plate rack.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, holds all your plates. Disclaimer. I have cast plates. I can not attest how it works with larger rubber weights. I fit 45s and 35s on one side and 5s,10s and 25s on the other with 2 1/2s in the center. I have over 300 lbs on it now and handles it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: iceman

customer_reviews.title: Love this unit. Would give 5 stars but getting all the weights on the tree is a trick
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. Use it everyday in my home gym. I can get all my weights on the tree, but it the pegs for the weights are a little close making harder to use that any I have every used in a commercial gym.
customer_reviews.author: bilru

customer_reviews.title: Mine was used
customer_reviews.text: It had been assembled prior, the bottom braces had the metal pulled up where everything was bolted down really tight before. Not a big deal because it's just to hold weights, but don't sell me something as new when it isn't new. A similar situation happened with the dumbbell rack I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Energy saver
customer_reviews.text: This plate tree is a life saver. I exert much less energy moving my plates around than I did when they were stacked on the floor. That energy savings alone is worth the price and then some. The quality is kind of crap, though, so be careful. The weld at the top of the tree is so terrible and sharp. I need to file it down. I'd imagine with rough use it might just split at some point. But for now, it works!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Missing Some Misc. Hardware, but Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 bolts, was super easy to assemble. We were missing some hardware though- when we opened the box all the hardware was Uncontained - ie not in a bag. We were missing two washers. For $60 value was good. They could’ve done better on packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable option I found
customer_reviews.text: Only negative thing I have to say is that I couldn't fit 10's above the 35's and had to place them in the middle... The sky is falling... Arrangement in the image is as stated below. Left Side: 45's, 25's Right Side: 35s, 5's, 2.5's Center" 10's and clamps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor experience with the product
customer_reviews.text: I had very poor experience with the product that I received. It was not easy to assemble due to missing parts. It was not sturdy because one of the feet were missing and I received no hardware. Due to the missing feet and hardware it kept falling over so stability was terrible. I contacted support and provided all needed information to fix the situation with no response. POOR PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Reaves

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Not enough space to fit plates made by other brands. other than that a cheap low frills home gym quality plate rack. if they made it a little bit bigger they could spaced it better to accommodate plates from other brands
customer_reviews.author: Benjistuie

customer_reviews.title: 5's and 10's do fit fine.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that the somewhat negative reviews about the 5 and 10 lb plates not fitting correctly and that might cause a problem, but it proved to be a non-issue. All of my weight plates fit perfectly. The stand is very easy to assemble and does exactly what it ought to do: hold my olympic weight plates.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I have 275lb on it now, which is basically all my free weights except rubber 45lbs. I wouldn't feel comfortable putting much more weight on it. Most certainly 500lbs seems dangerous. Value is great though. Perfect for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: jpl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Being honest, I love great products with a great price tag. Assembly is a breeze, it is very sturdy and again a great price compared to local stores here in Hawaii. It has helped me organize my weights so there are not stacked or leaning against the wall. As I build my gym, I will definitely get another one!
customer_reviews.author: C wasi

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to assemble, affordable. Not super stable but works
customer_reviews.text: This can hold all my 45s, 35s, 25s, etc and has not broken or been damaged since i've had it (~2 years). It is not very stiff, and can sway if you shake it. I trust it to hold the weight, but I would not try to move it with weight on it in anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: This isn't quite as sturdy as I thought it would be but it handles 370 pounds of steel plates no problem. The paint rubs off each time you load/unload plates but that doesn't bother me. As long as you don't abuse it by dropping/slamming plates onto/into it I think this weight tree should hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Coach Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!! Awesome!!!! Perfect!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is perfect partner to my weight set. I used to just stack my weights on top of each other it looked really crappy. having all of the plates displayed in a aesthetic fashion completes the home gym
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty good EXCEPT the carton is missing one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks pretty good EXCEPT the carton is missing one of the feet which makes it essentially useless. Have an email into CAP for the part; will update up or down depending on their responsiveness. 2/17/16 - add a star - CAP got my email about the missing part and next day'd it to me. Still 4/5 for missing a part in the first place, but customer service pulled it out.
customer_reviews.author: El Stevo

customer_reviews.title: not for bumper plates
customer_reviews.text: Fitness gear plates fit on these perfectly. There is slight wobble when racking 35lbs + plates, but this thing isn't going anywhere. Perfect for home gym use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: For what it cost it works good. My only complaint is you can’t use all the pegs, when I try to arrange the plates on it the side that has 3 pegs I have to leave the center one empty.could be a little taller so you can use all the pegs.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this weight tree
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this weight tree. Shipped FAST. Super easy and quick assembly. Gets all the weights off the floor and easily holds the 450 - 600lbs I store on it. The middle posts are not as useful to me as I am a BEAST and don’t toy around with baby weight plates, but I can at least hang my wrist straps in them.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. McEnaney

customer_reviews.title: Simple and worked as desired
customer_reviews.text: Ordered with knowing shipping could be out 1 - 2 months until delivery, however it delivered in about 1 week so that was good. Assembly is easy, 4 bolts and nuts. Sturdy enough to hold my plates and allow my garage gym to look neat. Simple and worked as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.GooglyMoogly

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took this item out of the box, it fell apart. The metal support was not welded together. This is RIDICULOUS! This was a Christmas gift for my husband and he can’t even use it.
customer_reviews.author: Krysta

customer_reviews.title: Fine for Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: It's fine, just what I needed. 2x45/35/25/10/2.5 and 4x10 plates. Pretty flex-y when you move the weights. FYI The instructions say to use 10 mm to tighten the nuts, but the nuts are 15 mm.. Use a socket wrench
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and more functional for us
customer_reviews.text: Holds the weights. We use bumper plates so I cut off the middle post on the side with 3 weight post and now it can hold 2 sets of bumper plates on that side and one on the other. I used a grinder then put some black paint on it. Looks good and more functional for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kiowa EM

customer_reviews.title: Solid product - glad to purchase it.
customer_reviews.text: Minor complaint about the screws not being threaded properly, so screwing them induced cramping (I had assembled other products as well that hour.) But for the price, it is a solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Singh

customer_reviews.title: holds 950 lbs no problem
customer_reviews.text: Great little weight tree. I'm storing 950 lbs of olympic weights on it and it doesn't wobble at all. I don't use the inside holders except for springs/clamps.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: First one was damaged and the welds were broke in 2 places. Second one they sent seems to hold up very well, easy to assemble. As of now its holding 255lbs of plates.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Jones

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the 300 lbs of olympic weight I have. Very sturdy and happy with the purchase although weights and equipment that goes with it is getting expensive.
customer_reviews.author: gqjfc

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: Using the product as intended for 2" Olympic weights (45#, 35#, 25# etc...). Once assembled, the rack is wobbly even after loosing the bolts in its intended place and tightening again to account for an uneven floor. I have a Rogue Monster squat rack next to it, and an X Mark flat bench both of which are nice and secure. I have moved it around the room and it is still unstable. Next time, I will pay a little more for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lister

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the price. It's worth noting that there are little plastic caps at the end of each arm. Pulling weights off the rack will easily pop these little caps off. It's not enough to drop a star but someone out there might care about that. If anyone is curious how to fit all the different plates on this at once (going by product picture): Left top arm: 25lb Left bottom arm: 45lb Right top: 10lb Right Middle: 5lb Right Bottom: 35lb Middle Top/Bottom: 2.5lb/misc
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of weights!
customer_reviews.text: Its a rack that holds weights! I've only put a little over 300lbs on it and it holds up no problem. From sealed box to assembled in 2 minutes if you speed run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for $30
customer_reviews.text: For $30, this is a great space saver. It got the weights off the floor and holds them all. As other's stated, the 5s and 10s don't fir correctly so you should put 5s or 10s on the middle part. I used the upper middle for clamps. Paint scratches very easily too so if you want something to stay pretty, this isn't the rack for you. Overall, great and strong product.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: HUGE WEIGHTS
customer_reviews.text: This is for weights with HUGE holes. If your using it for large weights it will work well but if your looking for something to hold your 25 or 30's this is not it
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Weight room is much less cluttered now, had my plates strewn across the floor. Easy to put together, just the two feet things.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great rack. Very strong and stable
customer_reviews.text: I love this weight rack. I just wish the side that has 3 bars were a little further apart. You can’t put large weight on that side but it works. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Agostinelli

customer_reviews.title: Super great deal!!
customer_reviews.text: Super great deal!! Anything local was easily 3 times this price -_- for same thing so Thanks!! Easy setup, just 2 screw ins, great quality, packaged and shipped well, and does it's job. I currently have 400 lbs (5-45lb weights) on mines and there is enough space in between the weights so they don't scratch and scrape each other on the rack. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: SoleCipher

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack for the Money
customer_reviews.text: All of my weights fit correctly and without issue. It seems sturdy enough and does what it should without issue. The reason I wanted to provide a review was due to the other reviews about weights not fitting. I have the Fitness Gear barbell and plate set from Dick's sporting Goods that cost me about $180. The 45 plates (and maybe the 35s too) are a little smaller than the average gym plate, but pounds are pounds to me. The set I have fits perfectly on this rack. I have a pretty decent home setup for when I can't make it to the gym. I think this is a solid rack for home use.
customer_reviews.author: JMitch

customer_reviews.title: STURDY AND CLASSIC
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy for the price. This product was east to assemble and I have ease with racking weights on and off.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the quality. Super quick assemble. I love the middle posts inside the A frame for smaller plates
customer_reviews.author: K Grant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Gold's Gym Grip Plates
customer_reviews.text: Assembled four bolts with a 17mm socket and rack feels solid Other reviews complained about plates overlapping. My review is for grip plates from Gold's gym. The side with 3 pegs fits 5, 10 and 25 perfectly. Even more space if I use it for CAP 2.5 lbs at top and then Gold's 5 and 10 lbs below. Gold's 25 fit easily on the other side. I don't have 45s but there seems to be lots of room for them.
customer_reviews.author: nozamA

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: During theses crazy times of COVID, I have been slowly adding to my home gym. This is the perfect addition to my collection of workout equipment. It's incredibly sturdy and does exactly what it's supposed to do. Definitely happy that I ordered it. I totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gaspare Chirco

customer_reviews.title: Holds plenty of weight
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, holding plenty of weight. Enough slots for plates of differing sizes and feels plenty duable.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Ignore negative reviews on this one. Excellent plate tree.
customer_reviews.text: I saw some negative reviews about this plate rack. Had no issues at all with it. Make sure your plates match the tree by looking at the product description (2 inch holes in plates). Tree is sturdy with plates on it. No plates hit. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great tree, wish it had wheels
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with the bolts until I got the angle perfect. Otherwise it's fantastic. Sturdy and convenient to use. Only con is lack of wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Heidrich

customer_reviews.title: Great rack unless you have all full size plates
customer_reviews.text: Some manufacturers (Hulk fit) make all their plates full size DIA regardless of weight. If this is the set you have, don't buy this model as you can only use one of the posts. It is made for weight plate sets that are smaller DIA for smaller weights. Buy the model with few posts spaced futher apart. Otherwise, great rack for the money.
customer_reviews.author: PC1

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Sturdy and I was able to assemble in just a few mins. I like the look and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: MMA

customer_reviews.title: good for plates, not for bumper plates
customer_reviews.text: This rack works well for what I got it for. It is a little shaky but so far it has held up well. This rack does not hold bumper plates
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Plates dont fit right on this tree
customer_reviews.text: The spacing between the spot for the 5's and 10's was not quite big enough for both to be there. I think it would have been great and worthy of 5 stars given the great price, but it's tough to rate something positively when it doesn't work as designed. (and I was using plates from CAP too).
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Olympic 2-Inch Plate Rack
product_meta.description: Keep your plates off the floor and right where you need them with the CAP Barbell 2 inch Plate Rack. Made for either home or commercial use, this rack offers ample storage for 2 inch plates, keeping them off your floor and right where you need them. Constructed of heavy gauge steel and powder coated, they look great and will last for years. The durable steel construction and powder coat finish make this plate rack a reliable storage space for Olympic Plates. Securely store and organize various sizes of weights with the SEVEN different plate posts. This plate rack has a 500 pound weight capacity. CAP Barbell is a leading distributor and provider of fitness equipment. Launched in 1982 with a small inventory of free weights and benches, CAP Barbell has grown over the past 30 years to include more than 700 products in 10 categories. Dimensions: 22L x 19W x 37H inches.
feature_bullets: Heavy Duty Construction; Made With Durable Steel and Finished in a Powder Coat Finish for Long Lasting Performance; Holds Weight Plates With a 2 Inch Center Hole (Olympic Weight Plates)
Specs: Assembled Dimensions Are 22″ Length x 19″ Width x 37″ Height; 500 pounds; Weight Capacity; Rack Weighs 21.5 Pounds; 30 Day Limited Manufacturer’s

EFFICIENT STORAGE – The design of this rack provides easy storage for Olympic plates; Store small weights on the inner top shelf, store larger weights on the 2 post side, and store medium sized weights on the 3 post side
PROTECT EQUIPMENT: This rack features a rubber base to protect floors from getting scratched or scuffed; Compact design of this rack makes it easy to store in your home or commercial gym
TRUST CAP has been a pioneer in the fitness industry with over 30 years of experience and locations worldwide; Chances are, if you have ever worked out before, you have used a CAP product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
